descriptions.edit: Start creating and editing your test.

intro.reports: Keep track of your evaluators progress and answering status while they complete your test.
intro.answers: Quickly get feedback on you project by analyzing data from other users' answers.
intro.analytics: Take a deep look into your test and see what people are saying about it.
intro.invite: Invite evaluators to answer your test!
intro.cooperators: Add cooperators who can help you improve your project and gather data for your studies.
intro.edit: Create and customize your tasks and heuristics for your research needs.
intro.finalReport: Prepare the final report for your heuristic evaluation by selecting the elements you want to include.

Introduction.title: UX Remote LAB
Introduction.subtitle: What about doing Usability Tests in remote?
Introduction.description: Join our OpenSource project and start creating your own usability LAB and share it with friends. Researching has never been easier!

Dashboard.subtitle: Here's what's happening with your research projects today

dialog.title: Create New Task
dialog.subtitle: Configure your task step by step

validation.validUrl: Must be a valid URL starting with http:// or https://

basicInfo.stepDescription: Define what participants will do in this task. This is the foundation of your user test - be clear and specific about the goals and expectations.
basicInfo.taskTitleHint: Give your task a clear, concise name that describes what participants need to accomplish
basicInfo.taskDescriptionHint: Provide detailed instructions for participants. Include the goal, context, and any specific steps they should follow.
basicInfo.taskDescriptionPlaceholder: Describe the task in detail. What should the participant do?
basicInfo.tipHint: Optional guidance or hints to help participants during the task
basicInfo.tipPlaceholder: e.g., 'Focus on the main navigation', 'Take your time to explore'

configuration.stepDescription: Configure where the task takes place and how participants will provide their responses. This determines the user experience and data collection method.
configuration.taskLinkHint: The website or application URL where participants will perform the task
configuration.estimatedTimeHint: The estimated time participants will need to complete this task
configuration.answerTypeHint: Choose how participants will provide feedback after completing the task
configuration.postTestHint: Enter the specific question you want to ask participants after they complete the task
configuration.postTestPlaceholder: e.g., 'How easy was it to find the product information?'
configuration.postFormHint: URL to an external form that participants will fill out after completing the task

configurationDescriptions.noAnswer: Participants complete the task without providing feedback
configurationDescriptions.textArea: Participants provide written feedback after the task
configurationDescriptions.postTest: Participants answer specific questions after the task
configurationDescriptions.postForm: Participants fill out an external form after the task
configurationDescriptions.nasaTlx: NASA Task Load Index - measures workload
configurationDescriptions.tam1: TAM-1 (Basic Acceptance) - measures perceived usefulness and ease of use
configurationDescriptions.tam2: TAM-2 (Extended) - adds external influences and results demonstrability
configurationDescriptions.tam3: TAM-3 (Comprehensive) - includes anxiety, playfulness, and objective usability
configurationDescriptions.sart: Situation Awareness Rating Technique - measures situational awareness

advanced.stepDescription: Enable additional data collection methods to gather deeper insights. All options are optional but can provide valuable behavioral data and user feedback.
advanced.eyeTrackingDesc: Track where participants look during the task. Provides heatmaps and gaze patterns to understand visual attention and navigation behavior.
advanced.screenRecordDesc: Record the participant's screen activity. Captures clicks, scrolling, and interactions to analyze user behavior and identify pain points.
advanced.cameraDesc: Record participant's facial expressions and reactions. Captures emotions, confusion, and satisfaction to understand user experience beyond interactions.
advanced.audioDesc: Record participant's verbal feedback and comments. Captures think-aloud protocols, frustrations, and insights that reveal thought processes.
advanced.privacyText: Recording features require explicit consent from participants. Make sure to:
advanced.privacyItem1: Clearly inform participants about data collection
advanced.privacyItem2: Obtain proper consent before starting the test
advanced.privacyItem4: Secure storage and handling of recorded data

preview.taskReadyMessage: Your task is properly configured and ready to be used in your study.
preview.reviewRequiredMessage: Please review the previous steps to ensure all required fields are completed.

answerTypePreview.taskCompleted: Task completed! No additional feedback required.
answerTypePreview.participantsFeedbackHere: Participants will provide their feedback here...
answerTypePreview.rateTaskDifficulty: 1. How would you rate the difficulty of this task?
answerTypePreview.externalFormDescription: Participants will be redirected to complete an external form after the task.
answerTypePreview.susStatement1: 1. I think that I would like to use this system frequently.

alerts.testAlreadyCompletedMessage: You have already completed and submitted this test. Thank you for your participation!
alerts.testExpiredMessage: This test is no longer available as it has passed its end date.
alerts.testNotActiveMessage: This test is currently not active. Please contact the administrator.
alerts.testConfigErrorMessage: This test has no tasks configured. Please contact the administrator.
alerts.consentDecline: Test ended due to consent decline. Thank you for your time.
alerts.sessionTooFarMessage: The scheduled session is more than 24 hours away. Please come back closer to the session date.

TaskStep.recordingInfo: This task will record the following data during your interaction:
TaskStep.screenRecordDesc: Captures clicks, scrolling, and interactions to analyze user behavior.
TaskStep.cameraDesc: Records facial expressions and reactions to understand user emotions.
TaskStep.audioRecordDesc: Captures verbal feedback and think-aloud protocols during the task.
TaskStep.eyeTrackerDesc: Tracks visual attention patterns and gaze behavior during the task.
TaskStep.newWindowDesc: When you start the task, a new window will open with the tool you need to use.
TaskStep.tipDesc: You can switch between tabs or close the new window at any time. The recording will continue until you complete the task.
TaskStep.internalInterface: This task will be completed within the current interface.
TaskStep.needHelpDesc: Having trouble? Get helpful guidance to complete this task.
TaskStep.reopenDesc: Accidentally closed the tool window? Reopen it here.
TaskStep.cannotFinish: I can not finish the task
TaskStep.noQuestionnaire: No post-task questionnaire required for this task type.
TaskStep.validationError: Please answer all questions before continuing.

ConsentStep.declineTerms: I do not accept the consent terms
ConsentStep.declinedMessage1: You have chosen not to accept the consent terms for this study.
ConsentStep.declinedMessage2: If you confirm this action, the test will be terminated immediately as your participation requires explicit consent to proceed. Your data will not be collected or stored.
ConsentStep.declinedConfirm: Are you sure you want to end the test without participating?

ModeratorWelcomeStep.welcome: Welcome to the Moderated Test Session
ModeratorWelcomeStep.description: As the moderator, you will guide the participant through the test process while observing their interactions via video call.
ModeratorWelcomeStep.instruction1: Start by opening the video call room
ModeratorWelcomeStep.instruction3: Use the step navigator to jump between test phases
ModeratorWelcomeStep.note: Your role is to facilitate and observe. The participant should complete tasks independently unless they specifically request help.

messages.noTasks: This test doesn't have any tasks.

errors.failedToSaveAnswer: Failed to save the answer. Please try again.
errors.failedToSubmitAnswer: Failed to submit the answer. Please try again.
errors.noTestDataMessage: Test information could not be loaded. Please try again later.

WelcomeStep.description: You are going to participate in a user test that aims to evaluate the ease of use and understanding of a digital application. This type of test helps us detect possible technological barriers and improve the experience for everyone.
WelcomeStep.phases: Throughout the test, we will guide you through different phases. In each one, you will be clearly told what to do. There are no right or wrong answers: what interests us is how you interact with the system.
WelcomeStep.summary: Here you can see a summary of the phases you will follow:
WelcomeStep.ready: When you are ready, click the button to start. You can move at your own pace and stop at any time if you need to.

PreTasksStep.title: Tasks
PreTasksStep.heading: Let's begin the tasks phase
PreTasksStep.description: You are going to complete {numTasks} tasks related to using the tool. There are no correct or incorrect answers: what matters is how you interact.
PreTasksStep.instruction: When you are ready, click the button to begin.
PreTasksStep.recordingDescription: During the tasks, we may collect different types of data to understand your interaction with the system. Depending on the specific task, the following may be recorded:
PreTasksStep.recordingNote: You will be notified before any recording begins. All data is collected solely for research purposes and handled according to privacy guidelines.

CalibrationStep.title: Eye Tracking Calibration
CalibrationStep.heading: Before starting calibration
CalibrationStep.description: We are going to prepare your device to record your eye movement. This will allow us to understand how you navigate the screen during the test.
CalibrationStep.process: Calibration involves following points that will appear on the screen with your eyes. It is important that you are in a well-lit place, sit comfortably, and keep your head stable.
CalibrationStep.instruction: When you are ready, press the button to start calibration.

eyeTracking.title: Eye Tracking Calibration
eyeTracking.description1: We will prepare your device to record your eye movements.
eyeTracking.description2: Follow the points that appear on the screen.

landing.feedbackTitle: Quickly get feedback on your projects
landing.feedbackSubtitle1: UX Remote LAB has been created to give a set of tools for different UX experts that want to create their own UX tests and perform it with the users.
landing.feedbackSubtitle2: COVID-19 has shown to the world that sometimes the physical presence of real users is not possible so we are here to solve this problem!
landing.uxSubtitle1: If you are a researcher, a company, or a professional that you want to perform an UX test, here you will find several tools to help to analyze and track your tests using different UX techniques.
landing.uxSubtitle2: Help us to grow up this Open Source community and join us on GitHub! :)
landing.footer: We are looking for new partners to help us to grow the project! Feel free to contact us on

help.createtest: How do I create a test?
help.createtestanswer: To create a test, begin by clicking on the plus icon, selecting Heuristic Test. Then, specify the particulars of your project. Finally, proceed to the dedicated manager page.
help.heuristictest: How I setup my Heuristic test?
help.heuristictestanswer: To set up your Heuristic test, start by accessing the 'Edit Test' option. Then, click on the plus icon button to add a title and the question to your heuristic. Next, navigate to the options section to create the answer options and their respective values. Finally, save the modifications.
help.deletetestanswer: To delete your test, navigate to the left sidebar and click on the 'Settings' button. Then, select the 'DELETE TEST' button.
help.createtemplateanswer: To create a template for your test, navigate to the left sidebar and click on the 'Settings' button. Then, select the 'CREATE TEMPLATE' option.
help.usetemplateanswer: To utilize a template, navigate to the Tests page. Under the Create Templates section, you'll find your personal templates. Additionally, you can explore public templates.
help.previewtestanswer: On the leftside bar, click on the 'Preview' option then start the test answering the questions & finally clicking the bottom right button to save and submit the preview which can be later analysed in the 'Answers' section.
help.importcsvanswer: To import your CSV, navigate to the 'Edit Test' section, then click the 'UPDATE' button. Select your CSV file containing the heuristics.
help.invitecooperatorsanswer: To invite collaborators, navigate to the manager page of your test. From there, select 'Cooperators' on the left sidebar. Click on 'Select cooperator' and enter the email of your collaborator. Choose the collaborators role, then send the invitation by clicking on the bottom right button.
help.analyseresultsanswer: To analyze your results, navigate to the manager page of your test. From there, select 'Answers' on the left sidebar. Here, you can visualize statistics, evaluators, and heuristics.
help.sendmessage: How to send a message to my cooperators?
help.sendmessageanswer: To send a message, navigate to the manager page of your test. Select 'Cooperators' from the left sidebar. Click on the three dots icon next to the cooperator you want to message. Then, choose 'Send a message' and write your message with a title and content.
help.browseAllCategories: Browse all categories to find the help you need
help.videoAltText: FAQ demonstration video showing the visual steps to solve the frequently asked question. No audio content is present in this instructional video.

test.title: Test

inquiry.title: Inquiry
inquiry.description: Gather insights through surveys, interviews, and other research methods.

inspection.title: Inspection
inspection.description: Expert evaluation using established usability principles and guidelines.

accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.description: Assess your product for accessibility compliance and best practices.

usability_unmoderated.name: Usability Testing (Unmoderated)
usability_unmoderated.description: Participants complete tasks independently while their interactions are recorded

usability_moderated.name: Usability Testing (Moderated)
usability_moderated.description: Real-time sessions with facilitator guidance and immediate feedback

card_sorting_unmoderated.name: Card Sorting (Unmoderated)
card_sorting_unmoderated.description: Participants organize cards independently, without the presence of a moderator, allowing data to be collected on how they group and categorize information according to their own logic.

ab_testing.name: A/B Testing
ab_testing.description: Compare two versions to determine which performs better

heuristic_evaluation.name: Heuristic Evaluation
heuristic_evaluation.description: Expert review using established usability principles and guidelines

cognitive_walkthrough.name: Cognitive Walkthrough
cognitive_walkthrough.description: Step-by-step evaluation of user task completion processes

manual_testing.name: Manual Testing
manual_testing.description: Human evaluators assess accessibility using assistive technologies

automatic_testing.name: Automatic Testing
automatic_testing.description: Automated tools to identify common accessibility issues

ai_assisted_testing.name: AI-Assisted Testing
ai_assisted_testing.description: AI-driven tools to identify and suggest fixes for accessibility issues
